content: summer time bolero created by crochet&copy summer time bolero materials 2 yarn bee soft & sleek dk low pill fiber color pretty in peacock light 3 100% low pill acrylic crochet hook size 4 50 mm yarn needle stitch markers scissors stitches/abbreviations chain s = chain s st s = stitch es double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet space s = space s slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet cluster = double_crochet cluster repeat = repeat work directions in brackets the number of times specified decrease = double_crochet 2 stitches together decrease = single_crochet 2 stitches together reverse single_crochet = reverse single_crochet notes decrease = yarn over insert hook in next stitch yarn over and pull up loop yarn over draw through 2 loops 2 times yarn over draw through all 3 loops on hook decrease = insert hook in next stitch yarn over and pull up a loop twice yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook double_crochet cluster = yarn over insert hook in same stitch yarn over and pull up loop yarn over draw through 2 loops 7 times yarn over draw through all 8 loops on hook reverse single_crochet = working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual with the single crochet the reverse single_crochet is also known as the crab stitch the bolero is worked in one piece from the neck down to the underarms stitches are then skipped to form armholes and the body is worked in one piece down to the lower edge move stitch markers up as your work progresses do not remove when creating the double_crochet cluster it puffs out on the wrong side of our work so we will be using the wrong side of our fabric as our right side of our work measurements finished length is approximately 13 1/2 instructions yoke row 1 chain 59 1 double_crochet in the 4th chain from hook beginning chain counts as first double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next 4 chs for front place stitch marker in last double_crochet made 1 double_crochet in next 8 chain for sleeve place stitch marker in last double_crochet made 1 double_crochet in next 30 chs for back place stitch marker in last double_crochet made 1 double_crochet in next 8 chs for sleeve place stitch marker in last double_crochet made 1 double_crochet in last 5 chs for front total 57 sts note move stitch markers up as your work progresses when 3 double_crochet is worked into a marked st move the stitch marker to the center double_crochet the second double_crochet made of the 3 double_crochet group row 2 chain 2 turn 1 double_crochet in next 5 sts 3 double_crochet in next st
